Kundt’s tube apparatus- It is a simple acoustical apparatus which is used to measure the speed of sound through a gas or a solid rod.

Take the piston and insert it inside the glass tube.
Now adjust the clamp on the metal rod stand; tighten it to hold the metal rod exactly at its center.
Insert the metal rod into the glass tube.

Longitudinal vibrations from rubbing the rod can be heard as sound; they cause the powder in the tube to get agitated.

Adjust the length of the air column inside the glass tube by moving the piston in and out gently.Repeat the process till resonance is attained. At this position maximum sound can be heard.When resonance is attained, the powder will be collected as heaps inside the glass tube.
The number of heaps formed and the total length from the first to the last heap are recorded.
